chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis M Felerski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, release for DRC if eligible.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by 12-31-2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 
Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis M Felerski

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 90 daysin the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 5 days time served,  release for DRC if eligible.  

Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges. 
Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, by 12-31-2022. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court denies defense request for expungement. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Louis M Felerski in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Louis M Felerski.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

State moves to revoke. Defense objects. The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated. Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Louis M Felerski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Anthony D Cotton appeared by video for Louis M Felerski.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to revoke the DPA. Defense does not oppose. Court takes the State's motion under advisement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Amount: $20.00
Signed and filed. Order for Substitution of Attorney's
Received and Filed. Proposed Order for Stipulation of Substitution
Received and Filed.  Stipulation for Substitution of Attorney's
Court in receipt of a JusticePoint report. Court scheduled review hearing to an earlier date with parties via email correspondence. Review hearing rescheduled for Septermber 20th, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Discharge Report
Received and Filed

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
No violent contact with DF and MF.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 21, Judge Davis. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 21.

Defendant Louis M Felerski in court with attorney Amanda Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights Form and Addendum
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 7/11/22 @ 2:30p
